--- Oyakata <oyakata@...> wrote:

> 
> Alternatively, this could be a tomato - tomahto kind
> of thing. The 
> word brings up enough discussion from time to time
> that it's 
> probably impossible to declare with finality what is
> the 'right' 
> pronunciation.

Jay, I think that seems to be the case. It's like
people who romanize an "n" before a b as a "m",
because it gets blended that way, versus those of us
who write it as an "n", because that's what an �� IS,
dang it, no matter how you SAY it. 

Difference here is that it changes the actual vowel
pronunciation. However, like the difference between
juupun 10 min and jippun 10 min, I think it is
probably regional--I never *heard* jippun when I was
first studying Japanese, until someone made a point of
it.
